result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S Bullock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay $100 fine plus costs. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives reading of Information. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to Counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty pleas to Counts 1, 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2. Counts 3, 4 are dismissed but read in for sentencing.  Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. State makes sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Michael S Bullock in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions progress meeting with State. Defendant thinks case has been resolved. State reviews offer.
No violent contact direct or indirect with HB, MB. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.

Defendant Michael S Bullock in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set. Defendant can appear by phone on 1/25 if necessary.  Status conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.
